intro: Terpsichore semihirsuta, commonly known as the hairy terpsichore, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Terpsichore semihirsuta is often found in woodland and shrubland habitats, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
